column4: Does anyone understand "dd" well enough to tell it to send 0's to sda, ignoring any errors? I can't make much sense of the man page. Does "sudo dd if=0 of=/dev/sda" approach being correct?
no, I think my (new) ssd's toast, even though badblocks gave an all clear. the dd command gave: dd: opening `/dev/sda': Read-only file system
